sprint_goal: Establish foundational infrastructure (Terraform, CI/CD), a full user authentication system (Cognito), and a functional, anonymous-user core calculator.
epic_coverage: User Account & Authentication, Core Calculator Functionality
key_deliverables: Live `dev` environment with Cognito User Pool; Functional login/logout flow; Basic calculator with arithmetic and history for anonymous users.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate user registration and login. Show a basic calculation (e.g., '5+3*2=11') and its appearance in the history panel.
success_criteria: All foundational tasks complete. US-053 and US-001 acceptance criteria met. E2E tests for login and basic calculation are passing in CI.
risk_factors: High capacity utilization; Complexity of Cognito OAuth2+PKCE integration; Parallel setup of FE, BE, and Infra.
mitigation_strategies: Prioritize critical path tasks first. Encourage close collaboration between FE/BE/DevOps. Accept that some lower-priority tasks may spill over.
integration_windows: Continuous integration between FE and BE throughout the sprint.
burndown_target: Complete 50% of hours by end of day 5.

sprint_name: Sprint 2: Data Persistence & Custom Mode Creation
sprint_goal: Enable full persistence of user data for History and Custom Modes. Build the complete UI wizard for creating new Custom Modes, allowing users to define and save their own calculators.
key_deliverables: Backend APIs for History and Custom Modes; Persistent history for logged-in users; A fully functional multi-step wizard for creating a new custom mode.
demo_objectives: Log in and show that calculation history persists after a refresh. Walk through the wizard to create a new (non-executable) custom mode and show it in the management list.
success_criteria: US-012 and US-041 acceptance criteria met. All backend APIs for user data are implemented and tested. User can successfully save a custom mode definition.
risk_factors: Complexity of managing state in the multi-step wizard UI; Ensuring robust data isolation in all backend services.
mitigation_strategies: Define clear API contracts early. Implement comprehensive integration tests for backend security rules.
integration_windows: FE wizard integration with BE create API by day 7.
burndown_target: Complete 50% of hours by end of day 5.

sprint_goal: Deliver the flagship feature: secure execution of user-defined custom modes. Implement offline data synchronization for robust user experience. Complete the first advanced electronics calculator (Ohm's Law).
epic_coverage: User-Extensible Functionality, User Data Persistence, Advanced Electronics Features
key_deliverables: Secure AWS Lambda for formula execution; Fully functional custom mode execution flow; Offline queuing for history; Ohm's Law calculator.
demo_objectives: Launch and use a saved custom mode to get a correct result. Go offline, perform a calculation, go back online, and show the history is saved. Use the Ohm's Law calculator.
success_criteria: US-047 and US-027 acceptance criteria met. Offline sync E2E test passes. P95 latency for formula execution is <500ms.
risk_factors: RISK-001: Security of `isolated-vm` sandbox. RISK-002: Complexity of offline synchronization logic. RISK-004: Lambda cold start performance.
mitigation_strategies: Mandatory security code review for Lambda. Extensive E2E testing for offline mode. Configure Lambda provisioned concurrency.
integration_windows: FE/BE integration for formula execution by day 6.
burndown_target: Complete 50% of hours by end of day 5.
